Package com.example.seqr.controllers

Class EventController

java.lang.Object
com.example.seqr.controllers.EventController
public class EventController extends Object
Controller class for managing Event data in Firestore database.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructs an EventController and initializes Firestore database reference.

    • checkInUser

      public void checkInUser(String eventID, String userID, String username, com.google.android.gms.tasks.OnSuccessListener<Void> onSuccessListener, com.google.android.gms.tasks.OnFailureListener onFailureListener)
      Handles checking in a user to an event
      Parameters:
      eventID - string representing the ID of the event
      userID - string representing the ID of the user being checked in
      username - string representing the user's username
      onSuccessListener - method to handle if user was checked in
      onFailureListener - method to handle if user was not checked in

    • getUserCheckIns

      public void getUserCheckIns(String eventID, String userId, com.google.android.gms.tasks.OnCompleteListener<com.google.firebase.firestore.DocumentSnapshot> onCompleteListener)
      Method to get all of check ins to an event from a particular user
      Parameters:
      eventID - string representing the ID of the event
      userId - string representing the ID of the user
      onCompleteListener - method to handle when all check ins are found

    • eventCheckInsSnapshot

      public void eventCheckInsSnapshot(String eventID, com.google.firebase.firestore.EventListener<com.google.firebase.firestore.QuerySnapshot> listener)
      Method to add a listener to a certain event
      Parameters:
      eventID - Registers a snapshot listener to observe changes in the "checkIns" subcollection of a specific event document.
      listener - method to handle whenever this event's data is updated

    • checkEventValid

      public void checkEventValid(String eventID)
      Checks an event document for validity of all fields. A single event fields are defined in the databaseFields array in this class; see EventController's private attributes to modify this array.
      • checkInQR string a QR code PNG converted into base64 to enable storage as a string
      • eventDesc string the description of the event
      • eventID string a 128-bit unique identifier randomly generated upon event creation
      • eventName string the event's name as entered by the user
      • eventStartTime string an arbitrary string allowing for flexible time entry
      • location string a text field describing the event location
      • maxCapacity number value for the maximum capacity of an event
      • organizer string the user's entered name during first-load of the SeQR app
      • organizerUUID string generated UUID from the device, or created during event creation
      • promotionQR string see checkInQR above
      Parameters:
      eventID - The eventID to check

    • updateEventCheckInCoordinates

      public void updateEventCheckInCoordinates(String eventID, String uuid, double latitude, double longitude)
      Takes a users coordinates and updates them when they check into an event
      Parameters:
      eventID - string representing the ID of the event
      uuid - string representing the ID of the user
      latitude - double representing latitude of user at check in
      longitude - double representing longitude of user at check in
